summary: Miami Football: Hurricanes' 2019 Schedule Analysis https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
title: Miami Football: Hurricanes' 2019 Schedule Analysis https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
description:
Things quickly change in the world of college football, and that wasn’t any different for the Miami Hurricanes last season. A year after finishing 10-3 and winning the ACC Coastal Division in 2017, the Hurricanes went a disappointing 7-6, including an embarrassing season-ending loss in the Pinstripe Bowl to the Wisconsin Badgers.

summary: Different Types Of Milk & Their Benefits!
title: Different Types Of Milk & Their Benefits!
body:
Different Types Of Milk & Their Benefits!

WHOLE MILK

Whole milk is cow’s milk with none of the fat removed. One cup contains about: 150 cal (12 g carbs in the form of lactose (milk sugar), 8g of fat, 8g of protein. None of the milk’s natural components are removed.

PROS: Whole milk provides us with essential proteins, extra calories from fats, as well as vitamins and minerals. Whole milk is easily accessible anywhere.

CONS: The versions…

summary: Shit vegans say #329:
title: Shit vegans say #329:
body:
"I’m not listening to your stories about how people have healed by reintroducing meat because that’s just anecdotal… However, here’s one vegan bodybuilder who proves that everyone can be fit and healthy on plants alone.“

"They weren’t doing it right”
“The American Dietics association says…… ”

“Those ex-vegan YouTubers were never really vegan!”

summary: Synthetic speech generated from brain signals.
title: Synthetic speech generated from brain signals.
body:
Synthetic speech generated from brain signals. Thoughts health innovators?

Stroke, traumatic brain injury, and neurodegenerative diseases can all cause the loss of the ability to speak. Some people with severe speech disabilities learn to spell out their thoughts letter-by-letter using assistive devices which track very small eye or facial muscle movements. However, producing text or synthesized speech with such devices is laborious, error-prone, and painfully slow. …

View On WordPress

summary: UN: No Screen Time for Babies; Only 1 Hour for Kids Under 5
title: UN: No Screen Time for Babies; Only 1 Hour for Kids Under 5
description: The World Health Organization has issued its first-ever guidance for how much screen time children under 5 should get: not very much, and none at all for those under 1.

summary: 14 Issues to Know Earlier than Getting Examined for an STI
title: 14 Issues to Know Earlier than Getting Examined for an STI
body:
At the moment it is extra necessary than ever to pay attention to the dangers associated to sexually transmitted infections (STIs).
There are round 20 million new instances of STIs in america annually, estimates the – a file excessive that quantities to a public well being disaster.
Along with these rising charges, ailments like gonorrhea have gotten and tougher to deal with.
There are a selection of causes for this nationwide enhance in STIs. The opioid disaster (substance use can result in riskier sexual conduct) is an element. So is the stigma towards STIs and the lower in assets for public schooling and testing.
To assist flip the tide on these rising charges, Healthline spoke with Courtney Benedict, the affiliate director of medical requirements implementation at Deliberate Parenthood, in regards to the 14 basic items each particular person ought to know earlier than getting examined.

1. Everybody must get examined for STIs


Anybody who’s sexually energetic wants testing. Nobody will be too younger or too outdated to get examined in the event that they’re sexually energetic.

2. How typically you need to get examined relies on your danger components


Youthful folks have the next danger for STIs. Of the 20 million new STI instances within the nation annually, half happen amongst ages 15 to 24, studies the .
Younger folks on this demographic ought to get examined yearly for chlamydia and gonorrhea. Everybody must be examined at the least as soon as of their lifetime for HIV.
Sure teams – like males who’ve intercourse with males – have the next danger for HIV than the overall inhabitants. Sexually energetic homosexual and bi males ought to get examined yearly, twice a yr, or extra relying on the variety of companions and encounters they’ve.
Remember that most STIs will not be detected instantly after a sexual encounter. The “window period” when infections are undetectable can final from one week to a number of months.
Seek the advice of the for extra info on testing home windows and frequency.

3. Get on PrEP should you’re in danger for HIV, and check extra typically and use condoms should you’re on PrEP


These with identified danger components for HIV ought to think about happening pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP). It is a each day remedy that is greater than 90 % efficient in stopping HIV if used appropriately, in keeping with the .
Individuals on PrEP ought to get examined for HIV and different STIs each three months. Condoms must be used as a part of a toolkit of protected intercourse to stop STIs aside from HIV.
“Every one of our health centers offer treatment for STIs,” stated Dr. Leana Wen, president of Deliberate Parenthood. “We additionally supply PrEP, a each day capsule that helps these at excessive danger of HIV scale back their danger of getting contaminated, in additional than 400 well being facilities throughout 44 states.
"If you do not have HIV, taking PrEP persistently daily can decrease your probabilities of getting HIV by greater than 90 %. Lots of our well being facilities additionally supply PEP, a collection of capsules you may take should you’ve been uncovered to HIV that lowers your probabilities of getting it.”
In the end, a doctor can decide any danger components and advise on how typically to get examined or on PrEP if needed.

4. Actually is the most effective coverage


Hiding info associated to signs out of your doctor will be dangerous for a affected person, because it might result in undiagnosed STIs.
“It is necessary to be as open and sincere as doable together with your well being supplier in order that they will help you,” Benedict said. “When you’re not sincere with us, then we will not be recommending the entire exams which are applicable for you.”

5. Getting examined is regular and needed


STIs are rather more frequent than many individuals suppose. Some reveals that as many as 75 % of adults will contract human papillomavirus (HPV), the commonest STI, inside their lifetimes.
Screening for STIs is simply part of regular healthcare – for everybody.

6. Prevention is the most effective drugs


Working towards protected intercourse – utilizing instruments like condoms and PrEP – will stop STIs and scale back your danger (and stress) for contracting one.

7. Know the place to get examined, how a lot it prices, and the way lengthy it is going to take


There are various totally different locations the place an individual can get examined for STIs, together with a major care doctor, a well being clinic, the well being division, and Deliberate Parenthood well being facilities.
Testing is commonly free or will be achieved for a low value, relying on the testing website and the affected person’s earnings and medical insurance.
A physician’s appointment is often the simplest place to start out. Additionally test Deliberate Parenthood’s listing or the for a close-by middle.
There are additionally quite a lot of at-home exams out there, however not all are dependable. Seek the advice of the Meals and Drug Administration’s database for a listing of authorized kits.
The time within the ready room – and for check outcomes – varies by testing website. The common wait time at a Deliberate Parenthood well being middle is 15 minutes to an hour, estimates Benedict.
Relying on the kind of check, some outcomes can be out there instantly. Others can take one to 2 weeks.

8. Do not self-diagnose from unreliable web sources


There’s a whole lot of unverified info and myths floating round on the web. So, when Googling about danger components and signs of STIs, flip to the most effective sources out there.
Along with verified websites like Healthline, the CDC has . Or higher but, ask your physician in particular person if you get examined.

9. Do not stress – even when the result’s optimistic, the STI is treatable


Many individuals fear they’ve an STI earlier than discovering out the outcomes. Do not. “You are not alone. We’re right here that can assist you,” Benedict stated.
“All the sexually transmitted infections that you simply may be getting examined for doubtlessly are treatable – even HIV,” assured Benedict.
With medicine, folks residing with HIV are “in a position to lead regular lives,” she says. However getting examined and understanding your standing is crucial for getting on the trail towards higher well being and avoiding transmitting the virus to others.
Deliberate Parenthood well being facilities even have onsite counselors to assist with stress and psychological well being points.

10. Anxious about outcomes? There’s an app for that


Many well being facilities are actually embracing know-how to scale back stress for sufferers.
Companies like Healthvana – now out there in clinics in additional than a dozen states – ship outcomes instantly and electronically through a smartphone app.
“As an alternative of listening to the anxiety-provoking ‘No information is nice information, we’ll solely name you if one thing is flawed’ after being examined, we work with HIV/STI testing clinics to ship your lab outcomes as quickly as they’re launched. And we ship them to your cell phone in a means that is simple to know and determine what to do subsequent, if something,” stated Ramin Bastani, CEO of Healthvana.
“That is particularly related for sufferers on PrEP who’re required to return again for testing each three months with a purpose to get their subsequent prescription,” he stated.

11. Speak to your companion(s)


When you check optimistic for an STI, you will have to notify your sexual companions (that is anybody you’ve got had intercourse with prior to now six months) to allow them to get testing and remedy.
However a dialog about sexual well being should not start or finish there. Ideally, it ought to occur earlier than intercourse.
“Speak to your companion about safety, and speak to them about their sexual behaviors. It’s going to be a little bit uncomfortable at first, however it will probably really assist you make selections about whether or not you need to interact in sexual exercise with somebody based mostly on their danger components,” Benedict stated.
Good communication will scale back your danger for STIs and your worries about getting them.

12. Nervous about 'the speak’ together with your companion? Get examined collectively


“Generally it is best to simply carry your companion in and have them speak to the physician or nurse with you,” Benedict stated.
Moreover, should you’ve already examined optimistic for an STI, you will want a plan – and getting your companion an appointment for testing is one of the simplest ways to point out you care.

13. There is no disgrace in getting an STI


Getting an STI “would not make anybody much less good, much less priceless, much less worthy of affection,” Benedict stated.
“The concept that folks with sexually transmitted infections are undesirable actually has a profound emotional influence on folks recognized,” she burdened.
“We actually are attempting to destigmatize sexually transmitted infections so we’re not fueling that fireside, so that folks do not feel… discouraged to return in and get examined and get handled,” Benedict stated.

14. Do not be afraid of intercourse


“Everybody deserves a intercourse life that is wholesome, protected, pleasing,” Benedict said. “And getting as comfy as doable speaking to your companions and to your healthcare supplier about sexually transmitted infections could make your intercourse much more pleasing.”

Read the full article

Good communication will scale back your danger for STIs and your worries about getting them.

14. Do not be afraid of intercourse

trail.content_raw:
At the moment it is extra necessary than ever to pay attention to the dangers associated to sexually transmitted infections (STIs).
There are round 20 million new instances of STIs in america annually, estimates the – a file excessive that quantities to a public well being disaster.
Along with these rising charges, ailments like gonorrhea have gotten and tougher to deal with.
There are a selection of causes for this nationwide enhance in STIs. The opioid disaster (substance use can result in riskier sexual conduct) is an element. So is the stigma towards STIs and the lower in assets for public schooling and testing.
To assist flip the tide on these rising charges, Healthline spoke with Courtney Benedict, the affiliate director of medical requirements implementation at Deliberate Parenthood, in regards to the 14 basic items each particular person ought to know earlier than getting examined.

1. Everybody must get examined for STIs


Anybody who’s sexually energetic wants testing. Nobody will be too younger or too outdated to get examined in the event that they’re sexually energetic.

2. How typically you need to get examined relies on your danger components


Youthful folks have the next danger for STIs. Of the 20 million new STI instances within the nation annually, half happen amongst ages 15 to 24, studies the .
Younger folks on this demographic ought to get examined yearly for chlamydia and gonorrhea. Everybody must be examined at the least as soon as of their lifetime for HIV.
Sure teams – like males who’ve intercourse with males – have the next danger for HIV than the overall inhabitants. Sexually energetic homosexual and bi males ought to get examined yearly, twice a yr, or extra relying on the variety of companions and encounters they’ve.
Remember that most STIs will not be detected instantly after a sexual encounter. The “window period” when infections are undetectable can final from one week to a number of months.
Seek the advice of the for extra info on testing home windows and frequency.

3. Get on PrEP should you’re in danger for HIV, and check extra typically and use condoms should you’re on PrEP


These with identified danger components for HIV ought to think about happening pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP). It is a each day remedy that is greater than 90 % efficient in stopping HIV if used appropriately, in keeping with the .
Individuals on PrEP ought to get examined for HIV and different STIs each three months. Condoms must be used as a part of a toolkit of protected intercourse to stop STIs aside from HIV.
“Every one of our health centers offer treatment for STIs,” stated Dr. Leana Wen, president of Deliberate Parenthood. “We additionally supply PrEP, a each day capsule that helps these at excessive danger of HIV scale back their danger of getting contaminated, in additional than 400 well being facilities throughout 44 states.
"If you do not have HIV, taking PrEP persistently daily can decrease your probabilities of getting HIV by greater than 90 %. Lots of our well being facilities additionally supply PEP, a collection of capsules you may take should you’ve been uncovered to HIV that lowers your probabilities of getting it.”
In the end, a doctor can decide any danger components and advise on how typically to get examined or on PrEP if needed.

4. Actually is the most effective coverage


Hiding info associated to signs out of your doctor will be dangerous for a affected person, because it might result in undiagnosed STIs.
“It is necessary to be as open and sincere as doable together with your well being supplier in order that they will help you,” Benedict said. “When you’re not sincere with us, then we will not be recommending the entire exams which are applicable for you.”

5. Getting examined is regular and needed


STIs are rather more frequent than many individuals suppose. Some reveals that as many as 75 % of adults will contract human papillomavirus (HPV), the commonest STI, inside their lifetimes.
Screening for STIs is simply part of regular healthcare – for everybody.

6. Prevention is the most effective drugs


Working towards protected intercourse – utilizing instruments like condoms and PrEP – will stop STIs and scale back your danger (and stress) for contracting one.

7. Know the place to get examined, how a lot it prices, and the way lengthy it is going to take


There are various totally different locations the place an individual can get examined for STIs, together with a major care doctor, a well being clinic, the well being division, and Deliberate Parenthood well being facilities.
Testing is commonly free or will be achieved for a low value, relying on the testing website and the affected person’s earnings and medical insurance.
A physician’s appointment is often the simplest place to start out. Additionally test Deliberate Parenthood’s listing or the for a close-by middle.
There are additionally quite a lot of at-home exams out there, however not all are dependable. Seek the advice of the Meals and Drug Administration’s database for a listing of authorized kits.
The time within the ready room – and for check outcomes – varies by testing website. The common wait time at a Deliberate Parenthood well being middle is 15 minutes to an hour, estimates Benedict.
Relying on the kind of check, some outcomes can be out there instantly. Others can take one to 2 weeks.

8. Do not self-diagnose from unreliable web sources


There’s a whole lot of unverified info and myths floating round on the web. So, when Googling about danger components and signs of STIs, flip to the most effective sources out there.
Along with verified websites like Healthline, the CDC has . Or higher but, ask your physician in particular person if you get examined.

9. Do not stress – even when the result’s optimistic, the STI is treatable


Many individuals fear they’ve an STI earlier than discovering out the outcomes. Do not. “You are not alone. We’re right here that can assist you,” Benedict stated.
“All the sexually transmitted infections that you simply may be getting examined for doubtlessly are treatable – even HIV,” assured Benedict.
With medicine, folks residing with HIV are “in a position to lead regular lives,” she says. However getting examined and understanding your standing is crucial for getting on the trail towards higher well being and avoiding transmitting the virus to others.
Deliberate Parenthood well being facilities even have onsite counselors to assist with stress and psychological well being points.

10. Anxious about outcomes? There’s an app for that


Many well being facilities are actually embracing know-how to scale back stress for sufferers.
Companies like Healthvana – now out there in clinics in additional than a dozen states – ship outcomes instantly and electronically through a smartphone app.
“As an alternative of listening to the anxiety-provoking ‘No information is nice information, we’ll solely name you if one thing is flawed’ after being examined, we work with HIV/STI testing clinics to ship your lab outcomes as quickly as they’re launched. And we ship them to your cell phone in a means that is simple to know and determine what to do subsequent, if something,” stated Ramin Bastani, CEO of Healthvana.
“That is particularly related for sufferers on PrEP who’re required to return again for testing each three months with a purpose to get their subsequent prescription,” he stated.

summary: Yellow Vests Turn Violent Again As Macron's 'Great Debate' Ends After weeks of more moderate protests, France's Yellow Vests are...
caption: Yellow Vests Turn Violent Again As Macron’s ‘Great Debate’ Ends After weeks of more moderate protests, France’s Yellow Vests are back in full swing following the end of President Macron’s unsuccessful 'great debate’ - during which thousands of town halls were conducted over a two-month period in the hopes of solving national issues through citizen debates.

summary: Day 3: traveling is hard while on a restrictive diet
title: Day 3: traveling is hard while on a restrictive diet
body:
My friend told me that my skin was glowing more than usual yesterday. ☺️ I went to a Happy Hour last night and got a water! mind over matter 💪💪

Traveling is going to be my most difficult challenge - I can already tell. I travelled to Dallas, and as soon as I landed, I was already hungry. I’m staying with a friend in Grapevine, so I asked her for some snacks. She handed me some cheese crackers, and without reading the label in depth, I started munching away. I realized halfway through that they were laced with preservatives, so after I finished that pouch, I snuck a banana into my room and polished that off.

I need to prep for the situations where I’m traveling and don’t have food on hand, such as staying at a friend’s place.
